title: Propulsion Assignment
description: This assignment covers the fundamentals of rocket propulsion, including propulsion theory, engine types, and fuel chemistry. Students are expected to demonstrate their understanding through problem-solving exercises and practical applications.

title: Combustion Analysis
description: This assignment focuses on the analysis of combustion processes, including chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and fluid mechanics. Students will conduct experiments and simulations to study combustion behavior and emissions.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description: In this project, students will design a rocket nozzle, considering factors such as flow dynamics, material selection, and performance optimization. The project will include both theoretical calculations and practical design work.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description: This quiz assesses students' understanding of aerodynamic principles, including lift, drag, and airflow behavior. Students will answer multiple-choice and short-answer questions based on their course materials.

title: Flow Analysis
description: This assignment involves the analysis of fluid flow in various contexts, including pipes, airfoils, and nozzles. Students will use computational tools to simulate flow behavior and assess performance metrics.

title: Heating Analysis
description: This assignment focuses on the analysis of heating processes in various systems, including engines, reactors, and heat exchangers. Students will apply thermodynamic principles to evaluate heating efficiency and performance.

title: Structural Design Task
description: In this task, students will analyze and design structural components for aerospace applications. This includes understanding material properties, load analysis, and design optimization techniques.

title: Orbital Calculations
description: In this assignment, students will perform calculations related to orbital mechanics, including trajectory analysis, orbital transfers, and rendezvous techniques.

title: Systems Engineering Exam
description: This exam tests students' knowledge of systems engineering principles, including requirements analysis, system architecture, and integration processes.
